trans-unit.source: During the relative course of an animation, a KeyTime instance specifies the precise timing when a particular key frame should take place.
Indicates whether this instance equals the specified object.

Comparing two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime> instances with differently typed <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTimeType> properties, including the special values Uniform or Paced, elicits a false return value.
The object to compare with this instance.
if value is a that represents the same length of time as this instance; otherwise .
Indicates whether this instance is equal to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref>.
The object to compare with this instance.
if value is equal to this instance; otherwise, .
Indicates whether the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref> structures are equal.

Comparing two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime> instances with differently typed <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTimeType> properties, including the special values Uniform or Paced, elicits a false return value.
The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
if the values of keyTime1 and keyTime2 are equal; otherwise .

Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref> instance, with the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTimeType"></xref> property initialized to the value of the specified parameter.
The percent parameter is passed as a double, ranging between the values 0.0 and 1.0.
The value of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref>.
A new instance, initialized to the value of percent.
percent is less than 0.0 or greater than 1.0.

Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref> instance, with the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTimeType"></xref> property initialized to the value of the specified parameter.
The value of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref>.
A new instance, initialized to the value of timeSpan.
Returns an integer hash code representing this instance.
An integer hash code.
Overloaded operator that compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref> structures for equality.

Comparing <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime> instances with differently typed <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTimeType> properties, including the special values Uniform or Paced, elicits a false return value.
The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
if keyTime1 and keyTime2 are equal; otherwise, .
To be added.
To be added.
Overloaded operator that compares two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref> structures for inequality.
The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
if keyTime1 and keyTime2 are not equal; otherwise, .
Gets the Paced value which creates timing behavior resulting in an animation that interpolates at a constant rate.
When a key time is set to Paced, available time is allocated according to the length of each of the key frames to determine the duration of each frame.
This will provide the behavior that the "velocity" or pace of the animation will remain constant.
A Paced value.
Gets the time when the key frame ends expressed as a percentage of the total duration of the animation.
When a key time is expressed as a percentage, the key frame ending time is specified as a percentage of the duration of the key frame animation.

For example, if a key frame animation has a duration of four seconds and 75% is given as the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime> percentage for the key frame, the key frame will end after the 3rd second.
A Percent value.
If this instance is not of type Percent.
Gets the time when the key frame ends expressed as a time relative to the beginning of the animation.
When a key time is expressed as a time span, the key frame ending time is specified as a time relative to the beginning of the animation.
For example, if the time span is set to "0:0:2", the key frame will end two seconds after the animation begins.
A TimeSpan value.
If this instance is not of type TimeSpan.
Returns a string representing this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref> instance.
A string representation of this instance.
Gets the Type value this instance represents.
A Type value.
Gets the Uniform value which divides the allotted time of the animation evenly between key frames.
When a key time is set to Uniform, the total allotted time of the animation is divided evenly between key frames.
For example, if the key frame animation has a duration of four seconds and there are four key frames, each key frame will last for one second and begin immediately after the preceding one ends.
A Uniform value.
